pages.about: About Us - Sweet Tooth Sweet Tooth Home About Us About Us HOME | ABOUT US Whether you're looking for new sweet treats to brighten your day or want to explore our delightful assortment, we have it all. Our confectionery shop is dedicated to providing the highest quality sweets, crafted with passion and care. From classic favorites to innovative creations, our range of products is designed to bring joy and satisfaction to every customer. We believe in the magic of sweets and their ability to create happy moments. Join our community of sweet lovers and discover why our products are cherished by so many. Our commitment to excellence ensures that every bite is a delightful experience. + 22 Years of experience in the confectionery industry % 96 Customer satisfaction in the last 5 years + 230 100 000 Pieces of sweets sold every year Meet Our Team Jenny Wilson CEO & Founder Jacob Jones Designer Dianne Russell Marketing & PR Savannah Nguyen Shipping & Distribution Shipping Worldwide Enjoy special financing and earn rewards with every purchase. 14 Days Return Take advantage of our 14-days free return policy for a hassle-free experience. Secure Payment We accept all major credit cards for a safe and convenient shopping experience. Get Our Full Catalog Stay updated with our latest products and receive our full catalog by filling out the form below. pages.privacy-policy: Privacy Policy - Sweet Tooth Sweet Tooth Home About Us Privacy Policy At Sweet Tooth, we take your privacy seriously. This policy outlines how we collect, use, and protect your personal information. 1. Information We Collect We collect personal information that you provide to us directly, such as when you make a purchase, sign up for our newsletter, or contact our customer service team. This may include your name, email address, phone number, billing and shipping addresses, and payment information. 2. How We Use Your Information Your personal information is used to fulfill your orders, provide customer support, and send you updates about our products and promotions. We may also use your information to improve our website and services, as well as to conduct research and analysis. 3. Sharing Your Information We do not sell, trade, or otherwise transfer your personal information to outside parties without your consent, except as necessary to fulfill your orders or comply with legal obligations. This includes trusted third parties who assist us in operating our website, conducting our business, or serving you, as long as these parties agree to keep your information confidential. 4. Data Security We implement a variety of security measures to protect your personal information. This includes using secure servers, encrypting sensitive information, and regularly updating our security practices to address new threats. While we strive to protect your information, we cannot guarantee its absolute security, and you provide your personal information at your own risk. 5. Your Rights You have the right to access, correct, or delete your personal information at any time. You may also opt-out of receiving marketing communications from us. To exercise these rights, please contact us at sweettooth@gmail.com. We will respond to your request as soon as possible. 6. Third-Party Links Our website may contain links to third-party websites. These sites have their own privacy policies, and we do not accept any responsibility or liability for their content or practices. We encourage you to review the privacy policies of these third-party sites before providing any personal information. 7. Changes to Our Privacy Policy We may update our privacy policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or legal requirements. We will post any updates on this page, and the revised policy will take effect immediately upon posting. We encourage you to review this page periodically to stay informed about how we protect your personal information. 8. Contact Us If you have any questions or concerns about our privacy policy or the way we handle your personal information, please contact us at sweettooth@gmail.com. We are committed to resolving any issues and ensuring your privacy is protected. 9. Children's Privacy We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under the age of 13. If we become aware that we have inadvertently received personal information from a child under 13, we will delete such information from our records. If you believe that we may have collected information from a child under 13, please contact us at sweettooth@gmail.com. 10. International Users Our website is operated in accordance with the laws of the country in which we are based. If you are accessing our site from outside this country, please be aware that your information may be transferred to, stored, and processed in our country. By using our site, you consent to such transfer and processing. 11. Data Retention We retain your personal information for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this privacy policy unless a longer retention period is required or permitted by law. When your information is no longer needed, we will securely delete or anonymize it. 12. Policy Acceptance By using our website, you signify your acceptance of this privacy policy. If you do not agree to this policy, you may not use our site. Your continued use of the site following the posting of changes to this policy will be deemed your acceptance of those changes. Sweet Tooth Home About Us Phone: +91-492-1682349 E-mail: sweettooth@gmail.com Adress: Referee Township,Begusarai, Bihar, India Privacy policy Terms and Conditions
pages.terms-conditions: Terms and Conditions - Sweet Tooth Sweet Tooth Home About Us Terms and Conditions Welcome to Sweet Tooth. These terms and conditions outline the rules and regulations for the use of our website and services. 1. Introduction By accessing this website, you agree to be bound by these terms and conditions. If you do not agree with any part of these terms, you must not use our website. These terms and conditions are subject to change at any time without notice, and your continued use of the website signifies your acceptance of any updated or modified terms. 2. Intellectual Property Rights Unless otherwise stated, Sweet Tooth owns the intellectual property rights for all material on this website. All intellectual property rights are reserved. You may access this material for personal use only, subject to the restrictions set out in these terms and conditions. 3. Use of Our Website You must not: Republish material from our website without prior written consent. Sell, rent, or sub-license material from our website. Reproduce, duplicate, or copy material from our website for commercial purposes. Edit or modify any material on the website. Use our website in any way that is damaging or may cause damage to the website. Use our website in any way that impacts user access to the website. Use our website in any way that is unlawful, illegal, fraudulent, or harmful. 4. Limitations of Liability Sweet Tooth will not be held liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, or consequential damages that arise from the use of, or inability to use, the materials on our website. This includes, but is not limited to, damages for loss of data or profit, or due to business interruption. 5. Accuracy of Information We strive to ensure that all information on our website is accurate and up-to-date. However, we do not guarantee the completeness or accuracy of the information provided. Sweet Tooth is not responsible for any errors or omissions, or for the results obtained from the use of this information. 6. Termination We may terminate or suspend your access to our website immediately, without prior notice or liability, if you breach any of these terms and conditions. Upon termination, your right to use the website will cease immediately. 7. Governing Law These terms and conditions are governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of our country. You irrevocably submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts in our location for the resolution of any disputes. 8. Links to Other Websites Our website may contain links to third-party websites that are not owned or controlled by Sweet Tooth. We have no control over, and assume no responsibility for, the content, privacy policies, or practices of any third-party sites or services. You acknowledge and agree that Sweet Tooth will not be responsible or liable for any damage or loss caused or alleged to be caused by or in connection with the use of or reliance on any such content, goods, or services available on or through any such websites or services. 9. Indemnification You agree to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Sweet Tooth, its directors, officers, employees, and agents from and against any claims, liabilities, damages, losses, and expenses, including, without limitation, reasonable legal and accounting fees, arising out of or in any way connected with your access to or use of our website or your violation of these terms and conditions. 10. Changes to These Terms We reserve the right, at our sole discretion, to modify or replace these terms and conditions at any time. If a revision is material, we will provide at least 30 days' notice prior to any new terms taking effect. What constitutes a material change will be determined at our sole discretion. By continuing to access or use our website after those revisions become effective, you agree to be bound by the revised terms. If you do not agree to the new terms, please stop using the website. 11. Contact Us If you have any questions about these terms and conditions, please contact us at sweettooth@gmail.com. 12. Entire Agreement These terms and conditions constitute the entire agreement between you and Sweet Tooth regarding the use of our website. They supersede all prior or contemporaneous communications and proposals, whether electronic, oral, or written, between you and Sweet Tooth with respect to our website. 13. Severability If any provision of these terms and conditions is found to be unenforceable or invalid, the provision will be limited or eliminated to the minimum extent necessary so that these terms and conditions will otherwise remain in full force and effect and enforceable. 14. Waiver No waiver of any term of these terms and conditions will be deemed a further or continuing waiver of such term or any other term, and Sweet Tooth's failure to assert any right or provision under these terms and conditions will not constitute a waiver of such right or provision. 15. Assignment You may not assign your rights or delegate your obligations under these terms and conditions without our prior written consent. Any attempted assignment or delegation without such consent will be null and void. We may assign our rights and delegate our obligations under these terms and conditions freely.
